intro: Corchorus chrozophorifolius, commonly known as the white burr plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to southern and eastern Africa, where it thrives in dry, arid environments. The plant is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and distinctive, spiny capsules that contain small, black seeds. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, adding to its ornamental value. The plant is often used in traditional medicine and has been studied for its potential pharmacological properties.
